aas:langStringTextType.aas:text: defaultAdminShell

The Digital Product Passport is a data record that summarizes the components, materials and chemical substances or information on repairability, spare parts or professional disposal for a product. The data comes from all phases of the product life cycle and can be used for various purposes in all these phases (design, production, use, disposal). Structuring environmental data in a standardized, comparable format enables all actors in the value and supply chain to work together towards a circular economy. This data model is based on the new proposed Ecodesign Regulation (ESPR-2022) and is continuously adapted to the basic conditions over time.
Passport Entity to describe version, status, validity and issue date.
Economic operator entity with identification and EORI.
Entity describing attributes such as the product description, class and different names.

Entity to describe the associated product category according to ECLASS. The ECLASS is the worldwide reference data standard for classifying and clearly describing products and services. Properties separated into the code and name.
Entity to describe different aspects in relation with the handling of the product. Properties are the maintenance history spare parts, substances of concern and reusable packaging.
The maintenance history of the product with dates, titles and descriptions.
Entity describing a list of entries of the service history with title, text, activities and dates.
The list of spare parts available for the product from a supplier.
Entity with the attributes partId, producerId and partName to describe a list of spare parts.
Details to the substance of concern.
Entity to describe a list of properties regarding a substance of concern such as the substance name, location, unit and concentration.
Characteristic with two possible values.
Entity with the properties state, al list of different materials, a list of critical materials and the product carbon footprint.
Information on different materials in the product.
Entity with properties materialName, percentage and flags for the possibility to recycle and renew the material.
The list of critical raw materials in the product (CRM) which is specified by EU.
Carbon Footprint Characteristic with sustainability information such as the carbon footprint total, rules and standards.

Product or sector specific rules applied for calculating or allocating GHG (Greenhouse Gas) emissions, e.g. PCRs (Product Category Rules), including operators or pubishers and according rule names as specified in the Catena-X PCF Rulebook in accordance with the technical specifications for PCF Data Exchange (Version 2.0.0) from the WBCSD (World Business Council for Sustainable Development)/ PACT initiative.

Entity for defining a product or sector specific rule of a product carbon footprint as specified in the Catena-X PCF Rulebook in accordance with the technical specifications for PCF Data Exchange (Version 2.0.0) from the WBCSD (World Business Council for Sustainable Development)/ PACT initiative.

aas:langStringNameType.aas:text: Operator or Publisher of Sector Specific Rules

aas:langStringTextType.aas:text: Name of a rule applied by a specified operator as specified in the Catena-X PCF Rulebook in accordance with the technical specifications for PCF Data Exchange (Version 2.0.0) from the WBCSD (World Business Council for Sustainable Development)/ PACT initiative.
Entity which defines specific characteristics of a product such as the lifespan and the physical dimensions.
Entity for the lifespan of a product with unit and value.
Entity encapsulating the physical dimensions of an object.
Commercial information such as placed on market and the warranty.
Operational information of the product such as the owner, manufacturer and importer.
Manufacturing Entity with the identification of the main manufacturer and the facility location.
Entity with identification information of the product with local identifiers, gtin, commodity code and other codes.

Codes for identification can be for example commodity codes. In Europe, two commonly used codes for goods classification are the Harmonized System (HS) code and the Combined Nomenclature (CN). Other codes can also be given.
Code entity with code name and value.
A local identifier enables identification of a part in a specific dataspace, but is not unique in Catena-X dataspace. Multiple local identifiers may exist.
A list of key value pairs for local identifiers, which are composed of a key and a corresponding value.
Entity for serialization information such as the quantity, the registration ids and the manufacturing date.
Quantity of the product with value and unit.
Entity for registration information such as the identification at the customer and the manufacturer.
Encapsulates the manufacturing relevant attributes
Entity with optional and mandatory sources. Mandatory sources are documents regarding the substance of concern and compliance.

Optional sources for the product. Optional sources can be a document regarding tool and process, assembly and disassembly, repair and installation, user manual, End of Life, return and disposal, expected waste generation, product packaging, positioning, waste prevention or sustainability information.
Entity for document sources of a product.
Document entity with header, content, category and type.
Entity for document sources of a product.
Document entity with header, content, category and type.
Document entity with header, content, category and type.
Document entity with header, content, category and type.

Compliance documentation and information required under this Regulation or other Union law applicable to the product, such as the declaration of conformity, technical documentation or conformity certificates.
Entity for document sources of a product.
Document entity with header, content, category and type.
Document entity with header, content, category and type.
Data in form of open fields which need to be transferred in addition.

Entity with additional data. Properties are label, description, type, data and children. Either the fields data or children filled. Children constructs a hierarchy with the same attributes. Data is filled as the end of an path/leaf.
Entity for type with unit and data type.
Children of the hierarchy.

Entity with additional data. Properties are label, description, type, data and children. Either the fields data or children filled. Children constructs a hierarchy with the same attributes. Data is filled as the end of an path/leaf.
Entity for type with unit and data type.

The Digital Product Passport is a data record that summarizes the components, materials and chemical substances or information on repairability, spare parts or professional disposal for a product. The data comes from all phases of the product life cycle and can be used for various purposes in all these phases (design, production, use, disposal). Structuring environmental data in a standardized, comparable format enables all actors in the value and supply chain to work together towards a circular economy. This data model is based on the new proposed Ecodesign Regulation (ESPR-2022) and is continuously adapted to the basic conditions over time.

aas:langStringDefinitionTypeIec61360.aas:text: The Digital Product Passport is a data record that summarizes the components, materials and chemical substances or information on repairability, spare parts or professional disposal for a product. The data comes from all phases of the product life cycle and can be used for various purposes in all these phases (design, production, use, disposal). Structuring environmental data in a standardized, comparable format enables all actors in the value and supply chain to work together towards a circular economy. This data model is based on the new proposed Ecodesign Regulation (ESPR-2022) and is continuously adapted to the basic conditions over time.
The current version of the product passport.
The current status of the product passport declared through either: draft, approved, invalid or expired.
The timestamp for the product passport until when it is available.
The timestamp for the product passport since when it is available.
The identification of the economic operator of the passport.
Any economic operator established in the customs territory of the Union needs, for customs purposes, an EORI number. EORI stands for economic operators registration and identification number.
The economic operator of the passport.
The passport metadata of the digital product passport such as status and validity.
A general short product description.
The associated product category CODE according to ECLASS.
The associated product category NAME according to ECLASS.
The associated product category according to ECLASS. The ECLASS is the worldwide reference data standard for classifying and clearly describing products and services.
The name of the product type.
Name of the part as assigned by the manufacturer
Name of the part as assigned by the customer
Properties further describing the product type.
The title of the data object with a maximum of 100 characters.
A short description of the maintenance content.
The dates when the product was put into service, repair etc.
The activities of putting the product into service in form of an enumeration with the values Inspection, Maintenance, Repair, Preventive Maintenance, Accident and Other.
The maintenance history of the product with dates, titles and descriptions.
The identification of spare parts available for the product.
The identifier of the producer. In the CATENA-X network the BPN identification of the spare part producer is needed.
The name of the spare part.
The list of spare parts available for the product from a supplier.
In accordance with the ESPR specification the name of the substances of concern which is present in the product have to be declared.
The location of the substances of concern within the product.
Units of concentration are percent, volume percent, parts per thousand, parts per million, parts per billion and parts per trillion.
The substance identification.
Details to the substance of concern.
Definition of whether the product uses a reuse system. The values true or false are allowed.
Properties connected with the handling of the product.
Status of the product (first life or second life).
The material name which is part of the product.
A flag if the material is recovered recyclate content from the product.

Flag if the material is made of natural resources that can be replenished. Renewable resources are those that can be reproduced by physical, chemical, or mechanical processes. These are the kind of resources that can be regenerated throughout time. Forest wood, for example, can be grown through reforestation.
Percentage of the material.
Information on different materials in the product.
The list of critical raw materials in the product (CRM) which is specified by EU.
Total carbon content per declared unit in context of a product carbon footprint as specified in the Catena-X PCF Rulebook.

aas:langStringNameType.aas:text: Operator or Publisher of Sector Specific Rules

aas:langStringPreferredNameTypeIec61360.aas:text: Operator or Publisher of Sector Specific Rules

aas:langStringDefinitionTypeIec61360.aas:text: Operator of PCR (Product Category Rule)/ PSR (Product Specific Rule) as specified in the technical specifications for PCF Data Exchange (Version 2.0.0) from the WBCSD (World Business Council for Sustainable Development)/ PACT initiative. WBCSD specific extension, in Catena-X for example must always be "Other".

Name of a rule applied by a specific operator as specified in the Catena-X PCF Rulebook in accordance with the technical specifications for PCF Data Exchange (Version 2.0.0) from the WBCSD (World Business Council for Sustainable Development)/ PACT initiative.

aas:langStringNameType.aas:text: Product or Sector Specific Rule Names

aas:langStringPreferredNameTypeIec61360.aas:text: Product or Sector Specific Rule Names

aas:langStringDefinitionTypeIec61360.aas:text: Product-specific or sector-specific set of rules used for calculating or allocating GHG (Greenhouse Gas) emissions applied from the specified operator as specified in the Catena-X PCF Rulebook in accordance with the technical specifications for PCF Data Exchange (Version 2.0.0) from the WBCSD (World Business Council for Sustainable Development)/ PACT initiative.

Other operator of PCR (Product Category Rule)/ PSR (Product Specific Rule) as specified in the technical specifications for PCF Data Exchange (Version 2.0.0) from the WBCSD (World Business Council for Sustainable Development)/ PACT initiative. WBCSD specific extension, in Catena-X for example specified by a default value.

Product or sector specific rules applied for calculating or allocating GHG (Greenhouse Gas) emissions, e.g. PCRs (Product Category Rules), including operators or pubishers and according rule names as specified in the Catena-X PCF Rulebook in accordance with the technical specifications for PCF Data Exchange (Version 2.0.0) from the WBCSD (World Business Council for Sustainable Development)/ PACT initiative.

Discloses a cross-sectoral standard applied for calculating or allocating GHG (Greenhouse Gas) emissions as specified in the Catena-X PCF Rulebook in accordance with the technical specifications for PCF Data Exchange (Version 2.0.0) from the WBCSD (World Business Council for Sustainable Development)/ PACT initiative.
Carbon Footprint property with sustainability information.
Properties which are relevant for the sustainability of the product.
The unit of the expected lifetime of a product from the unit catalog.
The value of the expected lifetime of a product.
The expected product lifetime (lifespan).
Weight of the item
Diameter of the item.
Height of the item.
Width of the item.
Length of the item.
Describes the physical dimensions of then entity.
Defines specific characteristics of a product.
Date on when the product is put in the market.

Commercial warranty period of the product (coupled to the Vehicle) in months. Durability and reliability of the product or its components as expressed through the products guaranteed lifetime, technical lifetime, mean time between failures, indication of real use information on the product, resistance to stresses or aging mechanisms.
Commercial information of the product.
The importer of the product, if different from the owner of the passport.
The facility Identification, where the main manufacturing took place.
The main manufacturer, if different from the passport owner.
Manufacturing identification of the product.
Operational information of the product.

GTIN stands for Global Trade Item Number. It is a unique and internationally recognized identifier used to identify products in the global marketplace. GTINs are typically encoded in barcodes and are used by retailers, manufacturers, and suppliers to track and manage their products throughout the supply chain. Valid inputs are all GTIN versions (GTIN-8, GTIN-12, GTIN-13, and GTIN-14).
Title of the code.
The code value of the specific code.

Codes for identification can be for example commodity codes. In Europe, two commonly used codes for goods classification are the Harmonized System (HS) code and the Combined Nomenclature (CN). Other codes can also be given.
The key of a local identifier.
The value of an identifier.
A local identifier enables identification of a part in a specific dataspace, but is not unique in Catena-X dataspace. Multiple local identifiers may exist.
Identification information of the product, especially identifiers and codes.

Quantity refers to the number of units or items of a product being bought, sold, manufactured, or stored as a batch.If the product is a single item choose the unit "unit:piece". All possible units are pieces, gram, kilogram, millilitres, litres, cubic meters, meters or square meters.
Quantity refers to the number of units or items of a product being bought, sold, manufactured, or stored. If the product is not a batch, choose the unit piece and value 1.0.

Quantity refers to the number of units or items of a product being bought, sold, manufactured, or stored. It is an important factor in inventory management, supply chain logistics, and pricing calculations.

Part ID as assigned by the manufacturer of the part. The Part ID identifies the part (as designed) in the customer`s dataspace. The Part ID does not reference a specific instance of a part and thus should not be confused with the serial number.

Part ID as assigned by the manufacturer of the part. The Part ID identifies the part (as designed) in the manufacturer`s dataspace. The Part ID does not reference a specific instance of a part and thus should not be confused with the serial number.
Registration information such as the identification at the customer and the manufacturer.
Timestamp of the manufacturing date as the final step in production process (e.g. final quality check, ready-for-shipment event)
Country code where the part was manufactured
Information from manufacturing process, such as manufacturing date and manufacturing country
Serialization information on the product.
The source name as an enumeration.
The content of the document e.g a link.
The category in which the document can be sorted.
The type of content which can be expected in the "content" property. Examples are a link, pdf, excel, etc.
The header as a short description of the document with a maximum of 100 characters.
Property for the document.

Optional sources for the product. Optional sources can be a document regarding tool and process, assembly and disassembly, repair and installation, user manual, End of Life, return and disposal, expected waste generation, product packaging, positioning, waste prevention or sustainability information.
The content of the document e.g a link.
The category in which the document can be sorted.
The type of content which can be expected in the "content" property. Examples are a link, pdf, excel, etc.
The header as a short description of the document with a maximum of 100 characters.
Document regarding the packaging of the product.
The content of the document e.g a link.
The category in which the document can be sorted.
The type of content which can be expected in the "content" property. Examples are a link, pdf, excel, etc.
The header as a short description of the document with a maximum of 100 characters.
Document regarding the safe transportation of the product.
The content of the document e.g a link.
The category in which the document can be sorted.
The type of content which can be expected in the "content" property. Examples are a link, pdf, excel, etc.
The header as a short description of the document with a maximum of 100 characters.
Document regarding the disassembly processes for the substances of concern.
The source name as an enumeration.
The content of the document e.g a link.
The category in which the document can be sorted.
The type of content which can be expected in the "content" property. Examples are a link, pdf, excel, etc.
The header as a short description of the document with a maximum of 100 characters.
Property for the document.

Compliance documentation and information required under this Regulation or other Union law applicable to the product, such as the declaration of conformity, technical documentation or conformity certificates.
The content of the document e.g a link.
The category in which the document can be sorted.
The type of content which can be expected in the "content" property. Examples are a link, pdf, excel, etc.
The header as a short description of the document with a maximum of 100 characters.
Instructions regarding the substances of concern.
Mandatory document and sources of the product.
Different sources in relation to the product.
The human readable name of the attribute.
The description of the attribute context.
Choose a unit type from the unit catalog, or if the property "children" is filled, leave empty.

Data type that describe the content of the attributes children and data. In case "object" is selected in the enumeration, the children field will be used in the AdditionalDataEntity instead of the "data" property. If it is an other type, the content will be specified in "data" as a string.
The complex description of the type.
The content from the attribute which is a depended of the data type and typeUnit.
The human readable name of the attribute.
The description of the attribute context.
Choose a unit type from the unit catalog, or if the property "children" is filled, leave empty.

Data type that describe the content of the attributes children and data. In case "object" is selected in the enumeration, the children field will be used in the AdditionalDataEntity instead of the "data" property. If it is an other type, the content will be specified in "data" as a string.
The complex description of the type.
The content from the attribute which is a depended of the data type and typeUnit.
Children of the hierarchy.
Data in form of open fields which need to be transferred in addition.
